title: More efficient logic is expected to process disk sorting for border values in row data
OB:
When sorting data on disk, if we sort on 40000 rows of data and set the program to process data less than 40000, the current behavior is as follows:
1. Save the file as a temporary file
EB:
When sorting data on disk, if we sort on 40000 rows of data and set the program to process data less than 40000, the expected behavior should be as follows:
1. Save the file as a temporary file
2. Load the file into memory
3. Sort the data
4. Save the sorted file as a temporary file
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Sort the data on disk
2. Set the program to sort 40000 rows of data
3. Set the program to process data less than 40000
4. Observe the behavior
